results.title: The Followers
results.creator_credit: Gilles Blais, Jacques Bobet, Georges Dufaux and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Filmed mainly at the Montreal community of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness, this film revolves around three young Quebecers, Michel, Robert and Johane, from their first days in the temple to their initiation six months later. The film examines the family life of Krishna members, the active proselytising in the streets, the temple rituals, and the role of women and their reliance on men for spiritual guidance. This film affords a close look at one of the controversial new religious organisations to have emerged from the Sixties in the United States. An English version of a French film.

results.title: The Day after trinity
results.creator_credit: Jon Else and KTEH-TV (Television station : San Jose, Calif.)
results.brief_description: A documentary on the life of J. Robert Oppenheimer, focusing on his role in the development of the atomic bomb and the dramatic events preceding the world’s first atomic bomb explosion on July 16, 1945. A penetrating commentary on scientific inquiry, Oppenheimer’s fall from grace during the McCarthy era, and the tragedy of continuing nuclear proliferation.

results.title: Tomorrow's child
results.creator_credit: Douglas Stanley and Nomad Films International
results.brief_description: With step by step precision and sympathetic understanding this film shows the fascinating story behind the latest amazing advances in ‘test-tube baby’ or more accurately, In Vitro Fertilisation techniques, with human embryo transfer by the Monash University Medical Team at the Queen Victoria Medical Centre.

results.title: The Water famine
results.creator_credit: Jack Beck and Columbia Broadcasting System Television
results.brief_description: The role of water in the birth and decay of civilization and the problems of man as he searches for new sources. The critical water shortage and the population explosion; the problems of pollution; desalinization demonstrated by the “flash freezing” process used in Israel and the electro-dialysis process used in the United States.

results.title: Two wheeler
results.creator_credit: Len Aitken, Bill Snyder and Oak Creek Films
results.brief_description: This film provides a penetrating view inside the world of bicycle racing. The colour and excitement of the sport are experienced as the camera follows a race from the exhilarating start to the pressure and frustration of the finish. Dramatic camera angles and comments by the racers involve the audience in strategy and techniques. There is appealing action for the non-bicycler as well as the seasoned racer.

results.title: A Memoir of the Bunurongs
results.brief_description: A brief memoir recording the sights, sounds and essence of Sorrento, a small seaside town nestled in between Portsea and Blairgowrie on the Mornington Peninsula. Evocative images are accompanied by a music soundtrack and text (in English).

results.title: NOISE on film: noise for Darfur = Why should Australians make noise for Darfur?
results.creator_credit: Darfur Australia Network and Infinite Films
results.brief_description:
This documentary has been produced to raise awareness about the continuing tragedy in the Darfur region of Western Sudan and build solidarity between the Australian people and the people of Darfur.
The conflict in Darfur has been continuing for more than three years, has resulted in the deaths of more than 400,000 civilians, the displacement of at least 2.5 million people and there are currently 3.5 million people dependent upon insufficient international humanitarian aid. Darfur is in crisis and the genocide has to stop.
The film includes footage from refugee camps in Darfur, artwork and music from a range of local artists, and the perceptions of a range of influential Australians as to why Australians should make NOISE for Darfur.

results.title: A Short portrait of Dennis Spiteri
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Jarrod Factor
results.brief_description: This brief snapshot portrait of Dennis Spiteri captures the essence of the Melbourne artist through a montage of graphic images. Written and directed by Jarrod Factor with original music also by Jarrod Factor.

results.title: Fire of the Land
results.creator_credit: Valerie Bichard, Eliza Johnson and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Prior to the Sydney 2000 Olympics, ashes from a sacred aboriginal fire were taken to Victoria Park Sydney establishing the Aboriginal Tent Embassy, peace camp. Fire of the Land is the story of the Embassy’s campaign to get international recognition for Aboriginal sovereignty, capturing an unique moment in Aboriginal Protest history.
